BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: GLEANERS FOOD BANK OF INDIANA INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: GLEANERS' MISSION IS TO LEAD THE FIGHT AGAINST HUNGER IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHEAST INDIANA BY COLLECTING, STORING, AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD TO THOSE IN NEED.
IRS990.MissionDesc: GLEANERS' MISSION IS TO LEAD THE FIGHT AGAINST HUNGER IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHEAST INDIANA BY COLLECTING, STORING, AND DISTRIBUTING FOOD TO THOSE IN NEED THROUGH A NETWORK OF AGENCY PARTNERS AND THROUGH DIRECT SERVICE PROGRAMS.
IRS990.Desc: AS INDIANA'S LEADING HUNGER-RELIEF ORGANIZATION, GLEANERS SOURCES AND DISTRIBUTES FOOD, BOTH PURCHASED AND RESCUED, TO HUNGRY HOOSIERS IN OUR 21-COUNTY SERVICE AREA. IN ADDITION, GLEANER'S OPERATES FRESH CONNECT CENTRAL, A PRODUCE DISTRIBUTION CO-OP THAT SECURES PERISHABLE FOOD FOR FOODBANKS IN 9 MIDWEST STATES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SINCE THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC BEGAN IN MARCH 2020, FOOD INSECURITY HAS RISEN DRAMATICALLY AROUND THE GLOBE. GLEANERS' 21-COUNTY SERVICE AREA IS NO DIFFERENT. PROGRAMS AND SERVICES HAVE HAD TO ADJUST TO ACCOMMODATE BOTH INCREASED NEED AND THE REALITIES OF SERVING IN A TIME OF SOCIAL DISTANCING. FEEDING AMERICA ESTIMATES OVER 378,000 HOOSIERS ARE DEALING WITH FOOD INSECURITY IN OUR SERVICE AREA. EVEN MORE CONCERNING, NEARLY 1 IN 4 CHILDREN ARE FACED WITH HUNGER. OUR PROGRAMS FOCUS ON FEEDING FAMILIES HEALTHY, NUTRITIOUS FOOD, INCLUDING FRESH FRUITS AND VEGETABLES, LEAN MEAT AND PROTEIN, DAIRY, AND SHELF-STABLE OPTIONS THAT CAN BE USED TO CREATE MEALS. MOBILE PANTRIES, SCHOOL-BASED PANTRIES, AND A GROWING NETWORK OF AGENCY PARTNERS AND COMMUNITY CENTERS JOIN TOGETHER TO MEET THE GROWING NEED. PROGRAMS FOCUSED ON NUTRITION, INCLUDING SUMMER NUTRITION CLUB FOR KIDS, COOKING MATTERS AND NUTRITIONHUB.ORG ARE GEARED TOWARD IMPROVING THE OVERALL HEALTH OF THOSE WE SERVE. SNAP OUTREACH, INCLUDING A SNAP HOTLINE, ASSIST CLIENTS WITH APPLICATION AND QUALIFICATIONS FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR FOOD PURCHASES. OUR ULTIMATE GOAL IS TO PROVIDE FOOD FOR TODAY AND HOPE FOR TOMORROW, OFFERING THOSE WHO ARE READY A HAND UP TO A PATH OF SELF-SUFFICIENCY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS: EARNINGS FROM THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED TO SUSTAIN THE OPERATIONS OF GLEANERS FOOD BANK OF INDIANA, INC.

GLEANERS HAS RECEIVED A DETERMINATION FROM THE U.S. TREASURY DEPARTMENT STATING THAT IT QUALIFIES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AS A TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATION; HOWEVER, GLEANERS WOULD BE SUBJECT TO TAX ON INCOME UNRELATED TO ITS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE. FOR THE YEARS ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2022 AND 2021, $-0- WAS ACCRUED FOR UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX IN ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS RELATED TO ESTIMATED TAXES ON LEASE INCOME
COST OF GOODS SOLD 4,390,887. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 190,726. CHANGE IN FAIR VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST -133,455.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 4,390,887. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 190,726. GAIN ON SALE OF EQUIPMENT -16,000.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: NON-CASH GRANTS - 266 AGENCIES - DETAIL AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST
CASH GRANTS - 98 AGENCIES - DETAIL AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: FOOD GRANTS ARE GIVEN ONLY TO 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE ESTABLISHED THE PROPER CONTROLS FOR SAFE FOOD DISTRIBUTION. WE PROVIDE GUIDELINES TO EACH RECIPIENT AND MONITOR EACH RECIPIENT ON AN EVERY TWO YEAR BASIS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FINANCIAL, REGULATORY, AND FOOD SAFETY REQUIREMENTS.

THE OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES LISTED ARE ALL ELIGIBLE FOR NON-FIXED PAYMENTS THAT ARE CALCULATED ON THE SAME BASIS AS THOSE FOR ALL EMPLOYEES UNDER AN "ALL EMPLOYEE SUCCESS SHARING PLAN". THE BASIS OF CALCULATION FOR THE NON-FIXED PAYMENTS INCLUDES, AMONG OTHER THINGS, MEETING OR EXCEEDING ORGANIZATIONAL FUNDRAISING GOALS AND ENSURING THAT TOTAL CASH EXPENSES OF THE ORGANIZATION DO NOT EXCEED TOTAL CASH REVENUES.
NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS IS AMOUNT OF FOOD ITEMS CONTRIBUTED IN POUNDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE CFO AND CEO/PRESIDENT, PRESENTED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW AND THEN SUBMITTED TO THE BOARD FOR APPROVAL. THE FORM 990 IS ALSO REVIEWED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD SIGNS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AT THE ANNUAL MEETING. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS ALSO INCLUDED IN THE EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK WHICH IS REQUIRED TO BE SIGNED BY ALL EMPLOYEES. IF A BOARD MEMBER HAS A CONFLICT, THEY ABSTAIN THEMSELVES FROM VOTING ON THAT ISSUE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CEO/PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BY EXTERNAL BENCH MARKING AND APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. KEY EMPLOYEES ARE GIVEN AN ANNUAL REVIEW BY THE CEO/PRESIDENT AND COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AT THAT TIME BY THE CEO/PRESIDENT, CONSIDERING EXTERNAL BENCHMARK INFORMATION. FREE BENCHMARKING DATA AND RESOURCES HAVE BEEN UTILIZED TO KEEP UP WITH THE MARKET AND ANOTHER INTERNAL REVIEW IS BEING CONDUCTED THIS YEAR USING EXTERNAL BENCHMARK DATA FOR ALL EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ADDITIONALLY, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.
